message:
Rust has had and continues to have a rough climb uphill to their 1.0 release compared to Go. In particular the rapid changes in the language usually ends up breaking BC and as such breaking community libraries. This call for contributions showed up on their mailing list. 

For anyone who's been meaning to hack on rust but not sure what to do or anyone already hacking on it but looking to make an impact.
Happy coding
story: Hady Ahmed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: [rust-dev] 7 high priority Rust libraries that need to be written
caption: mail.mozilla.org

data.message: So I want to contribute, then I see i18n, l10n, datetime, crypto. I run for my life!

Hahah, I feel you, they're a pain hence they're a priority but hey, pain heals. Chicks dig scars. Glory... lasts forever. [1]
[1] http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0191397/quotes?item=qt0318370
